data.title: Null reference exception on starting playtest-20130408

milestone.title: release-20131223
milestone.description: The next stable release should not have obvious glitches or horrible crasher bugs left.

data.body:
The game crashes every time on start-up due to a System.NullReferenceException. For example, see: http://pastebin.com/raw.php?i=WUJn5zKb

This is when using 64-bit Ubuntu and Mono 2.10.8.1. Previous versions of OpenRA don't suffer the same problem.

data.title: New C&C shellmap
data.body:
I'd like to see a new shellmap that cycles between a bunch of scripted mini-scenes that reset. The observer-shroud stuff can be used to partition off scene visibility in the map.

Unless (until?) somebody adds multi-tileset support, these would all have to share a tileset, probably temperat.

Some scene ideas:
- GDI staging base on a peninsula, with Orca & gunboat patrols, units are produced and shipped off via hovercraft (no combat).
- Nod flame tanks torching a village, with a church next to a tib field. Civilians panic and run into the tib field, where they become viceroids and destroy the nod troops.
- Nod base with walls, Sam sites, and Obelisks. Ion cannon takes out power, and then mammoth tanks and orca roll in (scene finishes before too much of the base is destroyed).
- Stealth tanks ambushing a GDI convoy along a forested road.
- Commando infiltrating a Nod base to free civilians from a prison.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/210179-new-c-c-shellmap?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Additional shellmap for RA
Chrono causes exeption
data.body:
We were playing a free for all with 4 players. At all computers (all windows 8) OpenRA closed without any display of error.

The exception.log contained the following execption:

Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: Out of sync in frame 7529.
 OrderString: "ChronoshiftJump" 
     Subject: "ctnk 382". 
     TargetActor: "" 
     TargetLocation: 62,109.
     TargetString: "".
     IsImmediate: False.
     Player(PlayerName): PiemelNeus

   at OpenRA.Network.OrderManager.OutOfSync(Int32 frame, Int32 index)
   at OpenRA.Network.OrderManager.CheckSync(Byte[] packet)
   at OpenRA.Network.OrderManager.<TickImmediate>c__AnonStorey12.<>m__4(Int32 clientId, Byte[] packet)
   at OpenRA.Network.ReplayRecorderConnection.<Receive>c__AnonStorey1A.<>m__17(Int32 client, Byte[] data)
   at OpenRA.Network.EchoConnection.Receive(Action`2 packetFn)
   at OpenRA.Network.ReplayRecorderConnection.Receive(Action`2 packetFn)
   at OpenRA.Network.OrderManager.TickImmediate()
   at OpenRA.Game.<Tick>c__AnonStorey39.<>m__9E()
   at OpenRA.Sync.<CheckSyncUnchanged>c__AnonStorey30.<>m__69()
   at OpenRA.Sync.CheckSyncUnchanged[T](World world, Func`1 fn)
   at OpenRA.Sync.CheckSyncUnchanged(World world, Action fn)
   at OpenRA.Game.Tick(OrderManager orderManager)
   at OpenRA.Game.Tick(OrderManager orderManager, Viewport viewPort)
   at OpenRA.Game.Run()
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)

data.title: allow factions to be loaded from a map, in the lobby
data.body:
Custom maps may have custom mods embedded, including custom factions. It would be very useful if you could pick a faction from within the map in the lobby, as this would allow you to use the auto-map-downloader to play a mod with factions, instead of having to download a custom mod separately beforehand. 
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/210181-allow-factions-to-be-loaded-from-a-map-in-the-lobby?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Render mines properly again and fix empty camo pillboxes in RA shellmap
data.body: I also tried to use the `CloakPaletteEffect:` from C&C, but it has no effect on RA so the camo pillboxes will still look like "black holes" when they turn on their camouflage.

Split multiple-production-queue widget logic into its own file

Mobile SAM launcher name shortened. 
Stealth tank time increased 80 -> 90 until https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/2898 is addressed.
Shortened a few other names.
Fixed some descriptions.

data.title: updated skull_valley map. Now supports 6 players.
data.body: ready to merge.

data.title: Implement observer shroud selector in C&C
C&C widget mouse event polish
data.body: Fixes the click-through and cursor issues with the sidebar and tweaks the tooltip delay to a better feeling value.

data.title: Resolve hotkey conflicts between build palette and world command widget once and for all
data.body: Build palette hotkeys require the ALT modifier now to avoid conflicts. This allows to change back the unit action hotkeys scatter / stance cycle to what they were before.

data.title: Keep replays compatible for review; fix up replay browser.
data.body:
Often you cannot view old replays because the games rules have since changed, or the map has changed. It would be nice if a few things were built into the replay, to reduce this.
-Include the map itself in the replay file (only ~5k). This way if the map has been modified since, or has custom rules, it won't be a compatibility problem. 
-Contain an actual copy of the rules & weapon stats used in that replay (<100k)

Also, I do lots of playtesting so it's nearly impossible in the replay browser to distinguish what replays I want to watch and which I don't.
In the replay browser I really need:
-To know what version mod the replay was using
-To know what mod the replay uses while browsing (cnc? cnc-classic? cnc-balance? ... custom mods?)
-To know the name of the map (including full filename, esp. if it's an "unknown map").
-A way to filter out all singleplayer games (preferably I just want to delete them entirely. Make an option to not record singleplayer games?)
And, if possible: -List the names of the players of the game

data.title: when player drops out, AI should take over
data.body:
Would be nice to have this. So game isn't completely screwed up if a player loses connection.
Don't know if this is even possible with current AI...

data.title: Display Ping of joining Clients in Lobby and use it to calculate OrderLatency
data.body: Addresses both #2124 and #2990. It will also result in Single-Player games being played with OrderLag = 1 instead of the hard-coded 3 now because pinging localhost results in << 120 ms round trip time.

data.title: Mouse is not constrained to window in windowed mode
data.body:
Currently running in windowed mode due to this issue:
https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/2430

But I have noticed that the mouse is free to leave the window in windowed mode. In windowed FPSs, for example, the mouse must be constrained to the window. 

Not sure which behavior is desired, but I would vote for the constraint option, as scrolling is difficult otherwise. At the very least we could have a checkbox for either option.

data.title: Don't crash when host leaves the lobby, fixes #2980

milestone.title: release-20131223
milestone.description: The next stable release should not have obvious glitches or horrible crasher bugs left.

data.body: This fixes #2980. I overlooked a NullReferenceException there.

data.title: Enhance the production queue (new pause/resume management)
data.body:
Here are some thoughts about improvements for the production queue.

My idea is the following : 
- You start building a refinery 
- You add barracks to the production queue
- You put the refinery on hold 
- At this moment, it would be interesting to be able to start the production of the barracks.

All the money spent on building the refinery would still be on hold, affected to it and waitting.

![prod_queue](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1732773/363118/f7a08a94-a1f9-11e2-9b2c-e5313d94cc9b.gif)

<bountysource-plugin>

---

</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Added filters and ping to server browser
data.body: I added checkboxes to filter the game list similar to https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRAWeb/pull/9 and a new button to ping servers one can join as latency seems to play a major role on the lag felt in-game.

data.title: OpenRA.Utility : Extract all SHP files to PNG at once
data.body:
Could it be posible to create a new command line option for OpenRA.Utility to export **all** SHP files from the game to an output folder (or the current folder by default) ?

openra.utility --extract ra temperat.pal 
openra.utility --extract ra *.shp 
openra.utility --png *.shp temperat.pal

data.title: Include team/spawn grouping metadata in map.yaml
data.body:
The map author should be able to define metadata specifying the best team arrangement (including spawn selection), allowing the Assign Teams dropdown to be replaced with an Auto-assign button that just does the right thing.

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/141921-include-team-spawn-grouping-metadata-in-map-yaml?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: Fix pause logic and C&C cheats menu
data.body:
The first two patches fix the broken pausing interaction with replays and the debug menu. The chat spam on pause/unpause has also been disabled for singleplayer games.

The final two patches (blocked by the pause fix) make the cheats logic robust against missing widgets and moves the panel to the ingame menu in C&C. The Desync button has been removed from C&C as I consider it unnecessary and unpolished.

data.title: Set order lag dynamically
data.body:
Setting every game to 120ms lag is silly, especially for singleplayer.

This should be simple to fix - the server can send a ping order to a client on join, and set the lag based on response time.

data.title: when shift-clicking on build order in cnc, takes you back to 1st tab
data.body:
In CNC there are multiple production sub-tabs (e.g. your barracks might have 3 tabs, for 3 barracks).
When you shift-click on E1 in tab 2 (to order 5 units), sometimes it takes you back to tab 1, and your next click goes to the building for tab 1. Can be really annoying because you can't quickly cycle through each tab and make a bunch of orders.

data.title: Infantry on parachutes makes idle actions in the air.
